description: This function generates images of objects measured with a ruler. It is designed to help students understand the concept of measurement and length in a visual and interactive way. The function can draw multiple objects with their respective rulers, making it useful for comparing lengths and sizes.

educational_standards.description: Estimate lengths using units of inches.
Estimate lengths using units of centimeters.
Generate measurement data by measuring lengths of several objects to the nearest whole unit.
Generate measurement data by making repeated measurements of the same object
Generate measurement data by measuring lengths using rulers marked with halves and fourths of an inch.

educational_standards.display_name: Measuring Objects in Centimeters and Millimeters
educational_standards.description: Use rulers to measure objects in centimeters and millimeters.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Ruler Measured Objects
stimulus_type_specification.description: The draw_ruler_measured_objects function creates visualizations of objects alongside rulers, which indicate their lengths. It accepts a RulerStimulus object as input, which contains a list of items, each with its own ruler. The rulers are drawn to scale based on the maximum length of the items in the list. The function is designed to help students understand and compare lengths of different objects. It is particularly useful in teaching measurement concepts in mathematics and science.

details: The function accepts a single input: a RulerStimulus object
The RulerStimulus object contains a list of items, each with a ruler
Each item in the list includes a ruler object with a length_in_cm attribute
The length_in_cm attribute controls the length of the ruler drawn for each item
The length_in_cm attribute must be a positive number
The list of items in the RulerStimulus object cannot be empty
Each item in the list must have a ruler with a valid length_in_cm attribute
The function draws a series of rulers and items, each with a length indicated by its respective ruler
The rulers are drawn to scale based on the maximum length of the items in the list
The length of each ruler and item is controlled by the length_in_cm attribute of the respective item's ruler
